Description: @games online is a DTP publisher dedicated to making fun, easy-to-learn and easy-to-play games. Current developments include the ACTION FRONT series and Devereaux County.

Hashtag 64 is an independent publishing house and development studio for board games, books, and other entertainment media. Beginning its activities in 2024, Hashtag 64 takes the concepts, theories, and philosophy of CEO and Founder Gabriele Areolite and transmutes them into tangible products designed to educate and entertain. Prior to 2024, the founder dedicated most of his time and efforts to his main company ARDEVUR Commodities, a multinational mining enterprise specialising in the global import/export of metal and mineral commodities. Drawing on the CEO‚Äôs decade long experience in the mining industry, Hashtag 64‚Äôs inaugural project ‚Äì ARDEVUR: The Game of Resources, aims to simulate the realistic dynamics of the mining industry and supply chain, while introducing what's beneath the surface: a fight for Total Control. In addition to bringing educational to the board game scene, Hashtag 64 is working on the launch an entire franchise of games and books that delve into hot topics such as the implication of technological advancement on our world, and the future of humanity. With a clear and structured roadmap of future releases, Hashtag 64 is ready to entertain you for the years to come! The Hashtag 64 Team

We are 11 bit studios - a game development company based in Warsaw, Poland, Europe, Planet Earth. Before founding the company, core crew members had been working in the industry since the early 90s. Over the last 15 years, we‚Äôve brought on the market more than 20 games, including such titles as : Starmageddon (Project Earth, US version), Infernal, Gorky 17 (US title: Odium), Knight Rider 2 and many others. Guided by an experienced management, our goal is to create exciting games for all kind of gamers - hardcore players as well as those who play on occasion - and to make the games easily available through digital distribution. The head concept behind the development is to devise unique and pioneering gameplay ideas, implement and deliver them to all main gaming platforms: consoles, computers and handhelds. While our daily job is to develop games, playing them after hours is our hobby. That's why we know exactly what players need. Based in Warsaw, Poland. Source: The Developer Website.

14games is a board game manufacturer based in Japan. We specialize in creating board games that prioritize the joy and challenge of gameplay, delivering experiences that resonate with their themes. 1A Games was established in order to carry on the Tide of Iron board game series originally created by Fantasy Flight Games. 1A planned to develop a series of railroad games (hence the military and railroad motifs in the 1A logo). In addition, 1A acquired the rights to Lombardy Studios and planned to publish a series of history books under that imprint that will complement and support the game lines. 1A Games closed in 2016. As of September 2024, a Tide of Iron fan site is still active on Facebook. Microbadges 1A Games fan

2K Games, Inc. (marketed as 2K) is an American developer, marketer, distributor and publisher of video games founded on January 25, 2005. 2K Games is a publishing division of Take-Two Interactive. 42Games is a creative collective using game design and interactive experiences as a form of expression. Our name stands for our project: to create 42 board games ‚Äî as the surreal and comforting answer that Douglas Adams identifies to the Ultimate Question of Life, the Universe, and Everything . While ‚Äú42‚Äù is an inscrutable answer, our project to make 42 games will allow us to explore new territories, new creative fields, and new forms of interaction ‚Äî both on the tabletop and digitally.

The company was founded in Kyiv, Ukraine, in 2006 by three developers who departed from GSC Game World. In 2014, 4A Games moved its headquarters to Sliema, wherein the Kyiv office was retained as a sub-studio. On 12 May 2014, amidst the Ukrainian crisis and following the annexation of Crimea by the Russian Federation, 4A Games announced that they were to expand by opening a new studio in and moving their headquarters to Sliema, Malta to allow for easier operations inside the European Union, with the Kyiv studio continuing to operate for Eastern European operations. In August 2020, the company was acquired by Saber Interactive under the Embracer Group for approximately US$36 million.

The association "Gioco Tarocchi Siciliani-Michael Dummett" is non-profit by configuring itself for its activities as a non-commercial (non-profit) body, and intends to carry out activities of social utility. The association was created to pursue the purpose to safeguard the ancient game of the Sicilian Tarot as an "intelligent" card game like the Bridge with affirmed strangeness from any divinatory or gambling practice, and promote its conservation through research, study, knowledge and dissemination, together with the enhancement of Sicilian history and culture and the territories in which it manifests itself. From the official site of the publisher.

A placeholder publisher that is intended for games that have not yet been published, and for which it is not clear who will publish it. Games may end up linked to this placeholder when a designer adds an entry for a completed design for which they have not yet found a publisher, or when a publisher has been found, but the designer does not yet want to disclose that information. Another scenario in which a game can get linked to this placeholder is when a publisher was found, but that publisher later decides not to publish the game.
User Summary This entry is for Video Games developed by an individual person rather than a publisher.

This is a generic company entry intended for all self-published board games, video games and pen-n-paper RPGS. A self-published work is produced independently, without the involvement of an established publisher and at one's own expense. This puts the author in full control of the entire process, including design, price, distribution, marketing, and public relations. The author may do all the work themselves or outsource some of the work to companies which offer these services. If the designer of a self-published game has a publishing brand, then a publisher listing should be created for that brand, with that brand then being added to the BGG game listing and the "self-published" tag being removed.

ESTREMO / Strasbourg, France This publishing house produced cardboard products and games and was officially registered in 1927. The publishing house's owner was Armand Moser. It was first mentioned in the address book in 1929. Its headquarters were at 11 Rue des Balayeurs (Feggasse 11) in Strasbourg. In the address books of 1930 and 1931, the publishing house was listed at 11 Rue de Lucerne (Luzerner Strasse 11). The publishing house appears for the last time in the 1934 address book. After that, it disappeared.
Publisher of the game ARISAKI DANCE et Ballet.

Rizal and Kashif are childhood friends who grew up playing games together while eating pizza. They used to go to each other‚Äôs house to play games like Crash Bandicoot, Dynasty Warriors, Star Wars Battlefront, and Metal Slug ‚Äì where splitscreen couch gaming became such an important part of their friendship! Games were such an integral part of their lives and through the years since their childhood, their friendship and bond through gaming remains as strong as ever. With gaming becoming more and more prominent in our everyday lives, they naturally wanted to share the joy and fun of gaming with their friends, families, and significant others. However, they noticed that it‚Äôs not that easy to game with someone who doesn‚Äôt know the first thing about gaming. Seeing this, they decided that rather than wait for someone to make games that can be played by both experienced gamers and newcomers, they would do it themselves instead! From official website

10:10 is a charity that enables people to take practical action on climate change, and combines these local actions to inspire a more ambitious approach to the issue at every level of society. Founded in 2009, 10:10 began by campaigning for a 10% reduction in carbon emissions in 2010, and has since broadened its approach to include a range of projects focused on carbon reduction and renewable energy. In 2019 10:10 published the card game Carbon City Zero.

12G Games is the publishing brand used by game designer Christopher M. Carter. Based in Chardon, OH, 12G Games published its first game, Close Call, in 2021. 12G Games was named in honor of Christopher‚Äôs two children. His son, Christopher Jr., wore the number 12 in all of his athletic endeavors, most notably baseball. The G represents gymnastics, the sport of choice for his daughter, Julia. The maple leaf on the logo represents Chardon, Christopher‚Äôs home town for more than 20 years, which is well known for maple trees and gourmet maple syrups. It is green because that is Christopher‚Äôs favorite color. The snowman meeple calls attention to the fact that Chardon is in the heart of Northeast Ohio‚Äôs snow belt. From the publishers website (http://1play.dk/en/welcome/): At 1Play, we specialize in developing fun games, meant to be played by the whole family. Our philosophy is; It should be fast and easy, to get the fun started! That is why our games will not take a lot more than two minutes to understand. We have a big selection of different games, everything in the range from Ludo Quiz and Who Finds It First?, to more classic games like Yatzy. We take pride in the art of special developed games. By doing so, we are sure to stand out in the market. One thing that we do not compromise, is the entertaining and surprising elements in our games! 1Play is a part of 1Conzept, where we cooperate with retail businesses and develop several products for their stores. If you are interested in these products, head over to http://1conzept.dk in order to see our current selection. If you are intrigued and want to know how we can help your retail, feel free to contact us. We look forward to getting to know you. Our games are developed with the Scandinavian market in mind, but we are open to expanding our horizon and help your stores in other markets. If you are in need of a localized quiz game, then feel free to get in touch with us. We are sure that we can create the perfect game together.

1x5 Games is dedicated to bringing unique games to the family gaming table. Formed at a beer festival while waiting in line for another pint in 2017, Heath Flor pitched the idea to Matt Rowntree, and the dynamic drunken duo formed like Voltron...minus 3 lions. Heath had perfect timing; after the second pint Matt will agree to anything. Both of them are LEGO enthusiasts with a desire to expand their artistic pursuits, and give other artists opportunities that may not have existed before. The team is currently developing card games, board games, and dice games. They reside in Prescott, AZ.

2 Brothers Gaming is a board game design company started by the brothers, Joe and Matt Noffsinger. Growing up, board and card games have always been a big part of any family gathering in the Noffsinger household. Through the years we have played all kinds of different games and learned the strategies and mechanics that make games fun. With all the years of playing games, we have finally decided to start creating our own games and use our knowledge of what makes them fun for everyone. Our premiere game is Burgers & Beasts, which is a family game that is easy to play, yet difficult to master, in that it differs every time you play it. From there, we plan to release 1-2 games a year (depending on complexity) of varying difficulty levels, from beginner to expert.

3 Headed Giant Games is a brand in the Quirky Engine Entertainment family. Our game developers focus on high concept strategy games that can easily be learned and played by veteran and novice gamers alike. We focus on character-rich games with stunning artwork and unsurpassed quality. 3 Headed Giant Games have a sense of humor. Our play testers understand that we expect players to laugh out loud at both the twists in gameplay and the character-based artwork on the cards, board, and other pieces. We believe that, whether you are fighting aliens, wielding a sword, casting spells, or joining a rock band, you should do it with a smile. 3 Headed Giant Games produces character-driven, light strategy games with a sense of humor, the ultimate escapes for players of any level of sophistication. 38 Studios, LLC, formerly Green Monster Games, LLC, was an American entertainment and IP development company founded in 2006 by Major League Baseball pitcher Curt Schilling and named for his jersey number. Originally based in Massachusetts, the company moved to Rhode Island as part of securing a $75 million loan guarantee from that state's quasi-public Economic Development Corporation (EDC). In February 2012, the company released its only title, Kingdoms of Amalur: Reckoning, a single-player action role-playing video game for several platforms. The game received positive reviews and sold an estimated 330,000 copies in its first month, rising to 1.2m copies in the first 90 days. 38 Studios shut down a few months later. The failure of the controversial Rhode Island loan spurred investigations by the news media and the government.

World Wide Wargames (3W), was a prolific producer of wargames founded by Keith Poulter in 1977. Initially located in England with games printed in Hong Kong by Simulation Games, the company first published The Wargamer magazine. After buying SPI from TSR and moving to California, it also published, for a time, Strategy & Tactics magazine and Moves. Both SPI magazines were then sold to Decision Games. 404 on Board is the new boardgame label from the French publishing house 404 Editions. 404 Editions is a French publishing house created in 2015, dedicated to pop culture and geek culture, for teenagers, young adults and adults. They have begun created games since their beginnings, with the Escape Boxes, and many little party games. Becoming a reference as a book publisher, the team has now decided to create their brand new boardgame publishing house, with the same spirit that has allowed 404 Editions to be successful: creating games for friends and family, to encourage spending great moments altogether! Born in July 2020, we have started to publish small party games such as ‚ÄúMaskot‚Äù, ‚ÄúNo Problemot‚Äù, ‚ÄúKilling Cards‚Äù and a range of solo card games for children called ‚ÄúH√©ro√Øcartes‚Äù, a ‚Äúchoose-your-own-adventure card game. Our first big project and boardgame is ‚ÄúVol de Nuit‚Äù or ‚ÄúNight Flight‚Äù, inspired from the famous novel ‚ÄúNight Flight‚Äù written by Antoine de Saint-Exup√©ry (the father of ‚ÄúThe Little Prince‚Äù), that will be available in French in June 2021. It‚Äôs a beautiful cooperative and family game from 2 to 5 players, designed by 4 friends (Ronan Legendre, Nicolas Minor, Paul R√©gu√®me & Louis-Arnaud Viard) and illustrated by Maud Chalmel. In September 2021, you will discover ‚ÄúOsirium‚Äù a tile placement and hand management boardgame, designed by Alain T. Puyss√©gur and illustrated by the famous Miguel Coimbra. We‚Äôre currently working on 2022, and can‚Äôt wait to be able to share with all of you our print & play, prototypes, and to meet you during fairs and festivals! Take care The 404 on Board team. 4Brain Games is a dynamic board game publisher specializing in immersive and interactive games, particularly focusing on escape room and detective themes. Their products, suitable for adults and older teens, are renowned for challenging puzzles, engaging narratives, and high replay value. Key titles include the "The Unknown Krimispiel" series and "Arkanum die Schatzinsel", each offering unique adventures in mystery-solving and treasure hunting. Committed to quality and innovative design, 4Brain Games continues to push the boundaries of traditional board gaming, creating memorable experiences for players and families alike.

Be bold. Be brave. Dare to be different, but always remain true to who and what you are. This is a rather tall order I hear you say... 4Ever Odd is a group of people and one determined rabbit who aims to make it as easy to do as it is to say. Why smother your creativity in order to fit in with the norm? If you have a song, sing it! If you have a picture, paint it! If you have a game, play it! And if people say, well, that's a little odd, then you have arrived! At 4Ever Odd we are eager to help you reach your full potential. So, welcome to the community of those who dare to be different. Be 4ever odd and enjoy every minute!

More important than games themselves is what effect they have on people. 4Fi was created to be something that represents community, inspires creativity, and encourages relationship building. Meet new people. Play for the fun of it. Build strong connections. 4Fi Games is owned and operated by Peter Guth in Lexington, Kentucky
